definition:
Let $(E_1, \mathcal{B}_1(E_1))$ and $(E_2, \mathcal{B}_2(E_2))$ be two
measurable spaces, with measures $\mu_1$ and $\mu_2$. Let
$\mathcal{B}_1 \times \mathcal{B}_2$ be the sigma algebra on
$E_1 \times E_2$ generated by subsets of the form $B_1 \times B_2$,
where $B_1 \in \mathcal{B}_1(E_1)$ and $B_2 \in \mathcal{B}_2(E_2)$.

The [*product measure*]{} $\mu_1 \times \mu_2$ is defined to be the
unique measure on the measurable space
$(E_1 \times E_2, \mathcal{B}_1 \times \mathcal{B}_2)$ satisfying the
property
$$\mu_1 \times \mu_2(B_1 \times B_2) = \mu_1(B_1) \mu_2(B_2) \text{\ for all\ } B_1 \in \mathcal{B}_1(E_1),\ B_2 \in \mathcal{B}_2(E_2).$$
